entry.title: Ferrari FF (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Ferrari FF (pictured) was, upon its release, the world's fastest four-seater car?

entry.title: a Paralympic gold medalist (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Paralympic gold medalist originally did not know that she qualified for parasports?

entry.title: Tauba Tauba (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Karan Aujla's Hindi-language single "Tauba Tauba" from the 2024 film Bad Newz became a Canadian Hot 100 top-25 song ahead of the film's release?

entry.title: Dani Sanchez-Lopez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dani Sanchez-Lopez wanted to be an actor but switched to cinematography after realizing that actors deliver others' lines?

entry.title: UnMetal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in UnMetal, the player has to heal any enemies whom they shoot?

entry.title: Shinichi Ishizuka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that manga artist Shinichi Ishizuka was told that becoming a manga artist would be "absolutely impossible"?

entry.title: two Wisconsin radio stations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two Wisconsin radio stations purchased and reassembled the Wisconsin Pavilion from the 1964 New York World's Fair for use as their studios?

entry.title: Yumeshima Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the extension to the Yumeshima Station was originally supposed to be opened in 2008 for when the Osaka Olympics was being bid for?

entry.title: Tonia Ko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tonia Ko once composed a three-part concerto played on bubble wrap?
